column4: what apricot means is that the WIN key is rather useless by default on ubuntu. Is there any way to map it somehow? A key menu editor?
Yes. but theres alot of things you can map it to.
any way to make it act a bit like in windows, e.g. WIN+R for run, WIN+E for nautilus?
guess I shoulda looked in there first. LOL
its a good place to start :D
doesnt seem to take to simultaneous keys
it might say <Alt> but it still works
oh hang on. it doesnt work :D
under the influence is when I type the fastest, and the most interesting things, normally

i do believe Super_L is already the name for it, and hence ben used already.... i dont know. like i said. too gorne :D
